ANSWER: In the year 852, Ibrahim ibn Yaʿqūb al-Kindī, often considered the first philosopher of Islam, contributed to the field of cryptography by developing one of the earliest known uses of statistical analysis to decipher cryptographic codes. Specifically, he utilized the frequency of letters in the Arabic language to help crack simple substitution ciphers.
